name: textile production, cotton, circular knitting | textile, knit cotton | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21451/documentation

Inventory refers to 1 kg knitted textile;This dataset covers  all relevant input and output flows of the represented gate to gate unit process with a good overall data quality. The inventory is  based on industry data. The dataset represents the Indian average of the knitted fabric manufacturing with circular knitting machines.;Knitting is a method by which thread or yarn may be turned into cloth by making consecutive loops called stitches. A new loop is pulled through each loop and a new loop is created. Knitting creates a fabric which is more stretchable and comfortable.;Circular knitting is a form of knitting that creates a seamless tube.  Knitting is worked in rounds in a spiral (the equivalent of rows in flat knitting). This form of knitting is used to create T- shirt Jersey fabric and socks;

The activity starts with Knitting

This process ends with conversion conversion of cotton yarn to knitted fabric
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/139:Manufacture of other textiles/1391:Manufacture of knitted and crocheted fabrics

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data has been collected from a knitting plant at Bhiwadi, Haryana,in North India
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Indian average, based on primary data collected from knitting unit, using current manufacturing technology in India.;Once the yarn is received in packaged form, it is placed in creel to feed the knitting zone into the feeder. Upon setting the specific yarn as per the fabric requirement, machine is set as per specific design requirement and the machine processes yarn into loops culminating into production of fabric.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Field visit and interviews. Staff from knitting unit were interviewed to provide data. Representative mills in Haryana (North India) was chosen to provide data based on its technical representativeness of the current state of business and their willingness to participate.
